required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Sweet PEA Study: Effects of Diet During Pregnancy on Infant Growth and Development.
clinical_study.official_title: The Sweet PEA Study: a Pilot Study of the Impact of Non-nutritive Sweetener Consumption During Pregnancy on Maternal and Infant Metabolic Health

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the Sweet PEA Study is to determine whether diet during pregnancy has an effect on infant's growth, body composition, and brain development.

primary_outcome.measure: Infant length at 1 Month
primary_outcome.description: Infant length (cm) will be measured using an infant measure mat.

primary_outcome.measure: Infant length at 6 Months
primary_outcome.description: Infant length (cm) will be measured using an infant measure mat.

primary_outcome.measure: Infant length at 12 Months
primary_outcome.description: Infant length (cm) will be measured using an infant measure mat.

primary_outcome.measure: Infant weight at 1 Month
primary_outcome.description: Infant weight (kg) will measured using a portable digital scale. For infants that need to be held, weight will be calculated as follows: (combined mother + infant weight) - (mother only weight).

primary_outcome.measure: Infant weight at 6 Months
primary_outcome.description: Infant weight (kg) will measured using a portable digital scale. For infants that need to be held, weight will be calculated as follows: (combined mother + infant weight) - (mother only weight).

primary_outcome.measure: Infant weight at 12 Months
primary_outcome.description: Infant weight (kg) will measured using a portable digital scale. For infants that need to be held, weight will be calculated as follows: (combined mother + infant weight) - (mother only weight).

primary_outcome.measure: Infant weight z-scores at 1 Month
primary_outcome.description: Weight and length will be used to calculate weight-for-length (WLZ) and weight-for-age (WAZ) z-scores using the WHO Child Growth Standards, as recommended by the CDC for children <24 mos.

primary_outcome.measure: Infant weight z-scores at 6 Months
primary_outcome.description: Weight and length will be used to calculate weight-for-length (WLZ) and weight-for-age (WAZ) z-scores using the WHO Child Growth Standards, as recommended by the CDC for children <24 mos.

primary_outcome.measure: Infant weight z-scores at 12 Months
primary_outcome.description: Weight and length will be used to calculate weight-for-length (WLZ) and weight-for-age (WAZ) z-scores using the WHO Child Growth Standards, as recommended by the CDC for children <24 mos.

primary_outcome.description: An EchoMRI infant body composition analyzer (EchoMRI LLC., Houston TX) will be used to measure infant body fat in grams.

primary_outcome.description: An EchoMRI infant body composition analyzer (EchoMRI LLC., Houston TX) will be used to measure infant body fat in grams.

primary_outcome.measure: Infant lean mass measured using an EchoMRI body composition analyzer at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: An EchoMRI infant body composition analyzer (EchoMRI LLC., Houston TX) will be used to measure infant lean mass in grams.

primary_outcome.measure: Infant total body water measured using an EchoMRI body composition analyzer at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: An EchoMRI infant body composition analyzer (EchoMRI LLC., Houston TX) will be used to measure infant total body water in grams.

primary_outcome.measure: Infant free body water measured using an EchoMRI body composition analyzer at 1 month
primary_outcome.description: An EchoMRI infant body composition analyzer (EchoMRI LLC., Houston TX) will be used to measure infant free body water in grams.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal height at 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Height (cm) will be measured using a stadiometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal height at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Height (cm) will be measured using a stadiometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal height at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Height (cm) will be measured using a stadiometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal weight at 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Weight (kg) will be measured using a portable digital scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal weight at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Weight (kg) will be measured using a portable digital scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal weight at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Weight (kg) will be measured using a portable digital scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal BMI at 1 Month
secondary_outcome.description: Body Mass Index (BMI) will be calculated based on the equation (weight in kg)/(height in m)^2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal BMI at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Body Mass Index (BMI) will be calculated based on the equation (weight in kg)/(height in m)^2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal BMI at 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Body Mass Index (BMI) will be calculated based on the equation (weight in kg)/(height in m)^2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal blood glucose at Pregnancy visit 2
secondary_outcome.description: Mothers will self-report their most recent blood glucose levels.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal pregravid BMI
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal BMI prior to pregnancy will be derived from pregravid BMI (recall during pregnancy) using the equation (weight in kg)/(height in m)^2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal blood pressure at 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Sitting blood pressure will be measured on the right arm after the subject has rested quietly for 5 minutes using a digital blood pressure monitor (Omron 3-series).

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal blood pressure at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Sitting blood pressure will be measured on the right arm after the subject has rested quietly for 5 minutes using a digital blood pressure monitor (Omron 3-series).

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal blood pressure at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Sitting blood pressure will be measured on the right arm after the subject has rested quietly for 5 minutes using a digital blood pressure monitor (Omron 3-series).

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal resting heart rate at 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Sitting heart rate will be measured on the right arm after the subject has rested quietly for 5 minutes using a digital blood pressure monitor (Omron 3-series).

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal resting heart rate at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Sitting heart rate will be measured on the right arm after the subject has rested quietly for 5 minutes using a digital blood pressure monitor (Omron 3-series).

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal resting heart rate at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Sitting heart rate will be measured on the right arm after the subject has rested quietly for 5 minutes using a digital blood pressure monitor (Omron 3-series).

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal diet at Pregnancy visit 1
secondary_outcome.description: 24-hour diet recalls will be conducted for one week day and one weekend day. Dietary intake will be collected and analyzed using the most current version of the Nutrition Data System for Research software (NDSR).

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal diet at Pregnancy visit 2
secondary_outcome.description: 24-hour diet recalls will be conducted for one week day and one weekend day. Dietary intake will be collected and analyzed using the most current version of the Nutrition Data System for Research software (NDSR).

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal diet at 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: 24-hour diet recalls will be conducted for one week day and one weekend day. Dietary intake will be collected and analyzed using the most current version of the Nutrition Data System for Research software (NDSR).

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal diet at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: 24-hour diet recalls will be conducted for one week day and one weekend day. Dietary intake will be collected and analyzed using the most current version of the Nutrition Data System for Research software (NDSR).

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal diet at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: 24-hour diet recalls will be conducted for one week day and one weekend day. Dietary intake will be collected and analyzed using the most current version of the Nutrition Data System for Research software (NDSR).

secondary_outcome.measure: Infant diet at 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: 24-hour diet recalls will be conducted for one week day and one weekend day. Mothers will be interviewed to report on their infant's food intake. Dietary intake will be collected and analyzed using the most current version of the Nutrition Data System for Research software (NDSR).

secondary_outcome.measure: Infant diet at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: 24-hour diet recalls will be conducted for one week day and one weekend day. Mothers will be interviewed to report on their infant's food intake. Dietary intake will be collected and analyzed using the most current version of the Nutrition Data System for Research software (NDSR).

secondary_outcome.measure: Infant diet at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: 24-hour diet recalls will be conducted for one week day and one weekend day. Mothers will be interviewed to report on their infant's food intake. Dietary intake will be collected and analyzed using the most current version of the Nutrition Data System for Research software (NDSR).

secondary_outcome.measure: Infant feeding score assessed by Infant Feeding Questionnaire at 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Infant feeding score will be assessed using the Baughcum Infant Feeding Questionnaire. Questions are scored using the following scale: 1-5; never, rarely, sometimes, often, always. Average scores will be used to determine the following constructs: concern about the child undereating or becoming underweight; concern about infant's hunger; awareness of infant's cues; concern about the infant becoming overweight or overeating; feeding the infant on schedule; using food to calm the infant; social interaction during feeding.

secondary_outcome.measure: Infant feeding score assessed by Infant Feeding Questionnaire at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Infant feeding score will be assessed using the Baughcum Infant Feeding Questionnaire. Questions are scored using the following scale: 1-5; never, rarely, sometimes, often, always. Average scores will be used to determine the following constructs: concern about the child undereating or becoming underweight; concern about infant's hunger; awareness of infant's cues; concern about the infant becoming overweight or overeating; feeding the infant on schedule; using food to calm the infant; social interaction during feeding.

secondary_outcome.measure: Infant feeding score assessed by Infant Feeding Questionnaire at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Infant feeding score will be assessed using the Baughcum Infant Feeding Questionnaire. Questions are scored using the following scale: 1-5; never, rarely, sometimes, often, always. Average scores will be used to determine the following constructs: concern about the child undereating or becoming underweight; concern about infant's hunger; awareness of infant's cues; concern about the infant becoming overweight or overeating; feeding the infant on schedule; using food to calm the infant; social interaction during feeding.

secondary_outcome.measure: Infant feeding style score assessed by Infant Feeding Style Questionnaire at 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Infant feeding style score will be assessed using the Thompson Infant Feeding Style Questionnaire. Questions are scored using the following scale: 1-5; disagree, slightly disagree, neutral, slightly agree, agree. Average scores will be used to determine the following constructs: laissez-faire; pressuring; restrictive; responsive; and indulgent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Infant feeding style score assessed by Infant Feeding Style Questionnaire at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Infant feeding style score will be assessed using the Thompson Infant Feeding Style Questionnaire. Questions are scored using the following scale: 1-5; disagree, slightly disagree, neutral, slightly agree, agree. Average scores will be used to determine the following constructs: laissez-faire; pressuring; restrictive; responsive; and indulgent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Infant feeding style score assessed by Infant Feeding Style Questionnaire at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Infant feeding style score will be assessed using the Thompson Infant Feeding Style Questionnaire. Questions are scored using the following scale: 1-5; disagree, slightly disagree, neutral, slightly agree, agree. Average scores will be used to determine the following constructs: laissez-faire; pressuring; restrictive; responsive; and indulgent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Infant behavior score assessed by Infant Behavior Questionnaire at 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Infant behavior score will be assessed using the Rothbart Infant Behavior Questionnaire. Questions are scored using the following scale: 1-7; never, very rarely, less than half the time, about half the time, more than half the time, almost always, always. Composite scores will be used to determine the following constructs: surgency/extroversion; negative affectivity; and orienting/regulation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Infant behavior score assessed by Infant Behavior Questionnaire at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Infant behavior score will be assessed using the Rothbart Infant Behavior Questionnaire. Questions are scored using the following scale: 1-7; never, very rarely, less than half the time, about half the time, more than half the time, almost always, always. Composite scores will be used to determine the following constructs: surgency/extroversion; negative affectivity; and orienting/regulation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Infant behavior score assessed by Infant Behavior Questionnaire at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Infant behavior score will be assessed using the Rothbart Infant Behavior Questionnaire. Questions are scored using the following scale: 1-7; never, very rarely, less than half the time, about half the time, more than half the time, almost always, always. Composite scores will be used to determine the following constructs: surgency/extroversion; negative affectivity; and orienting/regulation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Infant eating behavior score assessed by Baby Eating Behavior Questionnaire at 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Infant eating behavior score will be assessed using the Llewellyn Baby Eating Behavior Questionnaire. Questions are scored using the following scale: 1-5; never, rarely, sometimes, often, always. Average scores will be used to determine the following constructs: food responsiveness; satiety responsiveness; slowness in eating; enjoyment of food; and general appetite.

secondary_outcome.measure: Infant eating behavior score assessed by Baby Eating Behavior Questionnaire at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Infant eating behavior score will be assessed using the Llewellyn Baby Eating Behavior Questionnaire. Questions are scored using the following scale: 1-5; never, rarely, sometimes, often, always. Average scores will be used to determine the following constructs: food responsiveness; satiety responsiveness; slowness in eating; enjoyment of food; and general appetite.

secondary_outcome.measure: Infant eating behavior score assessed by Baby Eating Behavior Questionnaire at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Infant eating behavior score will be assessed using the Llewellyn Baby Eating Behavior Questionnaire. Questions are scored using the following scale: 1-5; never, rarely, sometimes, often, always. Average scores will be used to determine the following constructs: food responsiveness; satiety responsiveness; slowness in eating; enjoyment of food; and general appetite.

secondary_outcome.measure: Breast milk composition at 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Breast milk will be collected from mothers at least 11⁄2 hours since the last feeding and while the mother has fasted at least 1 hour. Samples will be analyzed for glucose, fructose, galactose, lactose and sucrose by mass spectrometry. Samples will be available for analysis of insulin, leptin, and energy content.

secondary_outcome.measure: Breast milk composition at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Breast milk will be collected from mothers at least 11⁄2 hours since the last feeding and while the mother has fasted at least 1 hour. Samples will be analyzed for glucose, fructose, galactose, lactose and sucrose by mass spectrometry. Samples will be available for analysis of insulin, leptin, and energy content.

secondary_outcome.measure: Breast milk composition at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Breast milk will be collected from mothers at least 11⁄2 hours since the last feeding and while the mother has fasted at least 1 hour. Samples will be analyzed for glucose, fructose, galactose, lactose and sucrose by mass spectrometry. Samples will be available for analysis of insulin, leptin, and energy content.

secondary_outcome.measure: Infant Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) brain scan at 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Infant brain will be scanned using Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) to measure structure and function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Infant Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) brain scan at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Infant brain will be scanned using Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) to measure structure and function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Infant gut microbiome at 1 Month
secondary_outcome.description: Stool samples will be collected in OmniGUT gene kits and aliquoted to be stored at -80oC. Gut microbes will be analyzed using 16S sequencing.

secondary_outcome.description: Stool samples will be collected in OmniGUT gene kits and aliquoted to be stored at -80oC. Gut microbes will be analyzed using 16S sequencing.

secondary_outcome.description: Participants will report the beverages they have consumed over the past week. This data will be used to assess nutritional intake based on beverages.

secondary_outcome.description: Participants will answer questions regarding their stress levels during and after pregnancy. Minimum = 0; maximum = 93. Higher scores represent worse outcomes.

secondary_outcome.description: Participants will answer questions regarding their stress levels during and after pregnancy. Minimum = 0; maximum = 93. Higher scores represent worse outcomes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pregnancy Physical Activity Questionnaire at Pregnancy visit 1
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will answer questions about their physical activity levels over the past week. Minimum: 0 (none), maximum: 5 (3 or more hours per day). Higher scores represent better outcomes.

secondary_outcome.description: Participants will answer questions about their physical activity levels over the past week. Minimum: 0 (none), maximum: 5 (3 or more hours per day). Higher scores represent better outcomes.

arm_group.description: Participants who self-report regular consumption of non-nutritive sweeteners (>/=5 servings/week) based on a pre-screening dietary survey.
Participants who self-report no consumption of non-nutritive sweeteners (0 servings/week) based on a pre-screening dietary survey.

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant women (18 - 40 years) who do and do not report non-nutritive sweetener consumption, and their infants (<1-12 months) from Los Angeles, CA.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Mothers:
- Pregnant women prior to 28 weeks gestation
- Report the least NNS consumption of pre-screened participants (0 servings per week - representing the control group) and most NNS consumption of pre-screened participants (≥ 5 servings per week - representing the experimental group).
- 18-40 years of age
- Singleton pregnancy
- Be able/willing to understand the procedures of the study
- Be able to read English at a 5th grade level (materials also available in Spanish, if required)
Infants:
- Infant's mother must be enrolled in the study and provide infant assent to participate
Exclusion Criteria:
Mothers:
- Physician diagnosis of a major medical illness
- Pre-existing diabetes (type 1 or type 2), or GDM in a previous pregnancy
- Physical, mental, or cognitive issues preventing participation
- Medications that may affect body weight, body composition, insulin resistance, or lipid profiles
- Tobacco or drug use (any current use or quitting during pregnancy)
- Alcohol consumption during pregnancy (>1 drink per week)
Infants:
- Presumed or known congenital birth defects

overall_official.affiliation: University of Southern California; Children's Hospital Los Angeles
